instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V8_SUS: What is PP1V8_SUS? PP1V8_SUS is a 1.8v power rail active in a suspend state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v 0A
threads.message:
no water damage, 20v amp pulsing 0a, 0.025a ,0.5a 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.6V stable.
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SUS</SIGNAL> 0-1.4v pulsing
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> 0v no short.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3v stable
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 0v no short
<SIGNAL>PP1V0_SUS</SIGNAL> 0v-0.9v pusling

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v 0A
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> pulsing too?
If yes, remove <RESISTOR>R8110</RESISTOR> and check again <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v 0A
threads.message:
So it now always boots?
If fans spin high, can be thermal sensor issue.
Could be also an effect of not recognized battery.
Run HWMonitor and check for strange temps reported.
You can also start in diagnostic mode.

Check what happens disconnecting webcam.

PLEASE, do NOT write an entire message in capital letters; is more difficult to read it.
We will appreciate if you use punctuation signs also.
You can also use normal quotes "" for partially references ; looks better, doesn't charge the post...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v 0A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v 0A
threads.message:
"Could be also an effect of not recognized battery."
You should try known good battery.

Seems no temp sensors issue, if no strange values reported.
But nothing to lose disconnecting internal LCD and testing with external monitor; if you cannot locate camera connector (on the LCD assembly).
